name: unawareness
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
the fact of not knowing, understanding, or realizing something: Part of the problem in recent years has been the unawareness of the importance of history among our political leaders.
More examplesFewer examplesWhen I first started policing as a young cop in Harlem, there was a total unawareness that alcohol was a drug.Though this all goes on just before the Second World War, the characters live in blissful unawareness of the future.The interviewees showed an amazing unawareness of the camera, which gave us the sense of being inside these events and not mere onlookers.Several themes emerged, including patients’ unawareness of early symptoms.
